During the school closures, Lucia Mar Unified School District (LMUSD) Food Services Department will provide an opportunity for families to drive through and pick up meals for the children in their family, at no cost, at a number of school sites. Children must be present in order for meals to be provided. The following schools will provide a lunch for the day and a breakfast for the following day. Please stay in your car and meals will be passed through to you based on the number of children in the car with you.

Pick up location (additional schools served)

Nipomo High School (Central Coast New Tech, Nipomo Elementary,Dana Elementary, Lange Elementary)

Arroyo Grande High School (Harloe Elementary, Paulding Middle, Branch Elementary, Ocean View Elementary)

Judkins Middle School (Shell Beach Elementary)

Fairgrove Elementary School (Oceano Elementary, Grover Beach Elementary, Grover Heights Elementary)

Active Shooter TRAINING at Arroyo Grande High School TOMORROW and SATURDAY.

The Arroyo Grande Police Department is hosting a regional active shooter training exercise at Arroyo Grande High School on Tuesday, July 30, 2019 and Saturday, August 3, 2019. The training will begin at approximately 8:00 A.M. and end at approximately 5:00 P.M. on both training dates.

During the training, you should expect to see a large law enforcement presence at the high school. You may also hear loud explosions or the sounds of simulated gun shots throughout the day, both of which are not emergencies and are part of the training exercise. Several areas of the campus will be blocked off with caution tape, and “Police Training” signs. A safety officer will be easily identifiable with a red training shirt and the participating officers will be in police uniform.

In addition to the police active shooter training, PG&E will also be conducting training in the area. Helicopters(s) may be used in these drills.

Please contact the Arroyo Grande Police Department for questions or concerns at (805) 473-5100.
